Module CollectiveIdea::Acts::NestedSet::InstanceMethods
In: lib/awesome_nested_set.rb

Any instance method that returns a collection makes use of Rails 2.1‘s named_scope (which is bundled for Rails 2.0), so it can be treated as a finder. 

  category.self_and_descendants.count
  category.ancestors.find(:all, :conditions => "name like '%foo%'")

Methods

<=>   ancestors   child?   children   descendants   is_ancestor_of?   is_descendant_of?   is_or_is_ancestor_of?   is_or_is_descendant_of?   leaf?   leaves   left   left_sibling   level   move_left   move_possible?   move_right   move_to   move_to_child_of   move_to_left_of   move_to_right_of   move_to_root   nested_set_scope   parent   parent_id   prune_from_tree   reload_nested_set   right   right_sibling   root   root?   same_scope?   self_and_ancestors   self_and_descendants   self_and_siblings   set_default_left_and_right   siblings   to_text   without_self

move_possible?(target)

[Source]

     # File lib/awesome_nested_set.rb, line 396
396:         def move_possible?(target)
397:           self != target && # Can't target self
398:           same_scope?(target) && # can't be in different scopes
399:           # !(left..right).include?(target.left..target.right) # this needs tested more
400:           # detect impossible move
401:           !((left <= target.left && right >= target.left) or (left <= target.right && right >= target.right))
402:         end

     # File lib/awesome_nested_set.rb, line 349
349:         def same_scope?(other)
350:           Array(acts_as_nested_set_options[:scope]).all? do |attr|
351:             self.send(attr) == other.send(attr)
352:           end
353:         end

to_text()

[Source]

     # File lib/awesome_nested_set.rb, line 404
404:         def to_text
405:           self_and_descendants.map do |node|
406:             "#{'*'*(node.level+1)} #{node.id} #{node.to_s} (#{node.parent_id}, #{node.left}, #{node.right})"
407:           end.join("\n")
408:         end

Protected Instance methods

move_to(target, position)

[Source]

     # File lib/awesome_nested_set.rb, line 467
467:         def move_to(target, position)
468:           raise ActiveRecord::ActiveRecordError, "You cannot move a new node" if self.new_record?
469:           return if callback(:before_move) == false
470:           transaction do
471:             if target.is_a? self.class.base_class
472:               target.reload_nested_set
473:             elsif position != :root
474:               # load object if node is not an object
475:               target = nested_set_scope.find(target)
476:             end
477:             self.reload_nested_set
478:           
479:             unless position == :root || move_possible?(target)
480:               raise ActiveRecord::ActiveRecordError, "Impossible move, target node cannot be inside moved tree."
481:             end
482:             
483:             bound = case position
484:               when :child;  target[right_column_name]
485:               when :left;   target[left_column_name]
486:               when :right;  target[right_column_name] + 1
487:               when :root;   1
488:               else raise ActiveRecord::ActiveRecordError, "Position should be :child, :left, :right or :root ('#{position}' received)."
489:             end
490:           
491:             if bound > self[right_column_name]
492:               bound = bound - 1
493:               other_bound = self[right_column_name] + 1
494:             else
495:               other_bound = self[left_column_name] - 1
496:             end
497: 
498:             # there would be no change
499:             return if bound == self[right_column_name] || bound == self[left_column_name]
500:           
501:             # we have defined the boundaries of two non-overlapping intervals, 
502:             # so sorting puts both the intervals and their boundaries in order
503:             a, b, c, d = [self[left_column_name], self[right_column_name], bound, other_bound].sort
504: 
505:             new_parent = case position
506:               when :child;  target.id
507:               when :root;   nil
508:               else          target[parent_column_name]
509:             end
510: 
511:             self.class.base_class.update_all([
512:               "#{quoted_left_column_name} = CASE " +
513:                 "WHEN #{quoted_left_column_name} BETWEEN :a AND :b " +
514:                   "THEN #{quoted_left_column_name} + :d - :b " +
515:                 "WHEN #{quoted_left_column_name} BETWEEN :c AND :d " +
516:                   "THEN #{quoted_left_column_name} + :a - :c " +
517:                 "ELSE #{quoted_left_column_name} END, " +
518:               "#{quoted_right_column_name} = CASE " +
519:                 "WHEN #{quoted_right_column_name} BETWEEN :a AND :b " +
520:                   "THEN #{quoted_right_column_name} + :d - :b " +
521:                 "WHEN #{quoted_right_column_name} BETWEEN :c AND :d " +
522:                   "THEN #{quoted_right_column_name} + :a - :c " +
523:                 "ELSE #{quoted_right_column_name} END, " +
524:               "#{quoted_parent_column_name} = CASE " +
525:                 "WHEN #{self.class.base_class.primary_key} = :id THEN :new_parent " +
526:                 "ELSE #{quoted_parent_column_name} END",
527:               {:a => a, :b => b, :c => c, :d => d, :id => self.id, :new_parent => new_parent}
528:             ], nested_set_scope.proxy_options[:conditions])
529:           end
530:           target.reload_nested_set if target
531:           self.reload_nested_set
532:           callback(:after_move)
533:         end
nested_set_scope()

All nested set queries should use this nested_set_scope, which performs finds on the base ActiveRecord class, using the :scope declared in the acts_as_nested_set declaration.

[Source]

     # File lib/awesome_nested_set.rb, line 419
419:         def nested_set_scope
420:           options = {:order => quoted_left_column_name}
421:           scopes = Array(acts_as_nested_set_options[:scope])
422:           options[:conditions] = scopes.inject({}) do |conditions,attr|
423:             conditions.merge attr => self[attr]
424:           end unless scopes.empty?
425:           self.class.base_class.scoped options
426:         end
prune_from_tree()

Prunes a branch off of the tree, shifting all of the elements on the right back to the left so the counts still work.

[Source]

     # File lib/awesome_nested_set.rb, line 438
438:         def prune_from_tree
439:           return if right.nil? || left.nil?
440:           diff = right - left + 1
441: 
442:           delete_method = acts_as_nested_set_options[:dependent] == :destroy ?
443:             :destroy_all : :delete_all
444: 
445:           self.class.base_class.transaction do
446:             nested_set_scope.send(delete_method,
447:               ["#{quoted_left_column_name} > ? AND #{quoted_right_column_name} < ?",
448:                 left, right]
449:             )
450:             nested_set_scope.update_all(
451:               ["#{quoted_left_column_name} = (#{quoted_left_column_name} - ?)", diff],
452:               ["#{quoted_left_column_name} >= ?", right]
453:             )
454:             nested_set_scope.update_all(
455:               ["#{quoted_right_column_name} = (#{quoted_right_column_name} - ?)", diff],
456:               ["#{quoted_right_column_name} >= ?", right]
457:             )
458:           end
459:         end
reload_nested_set()

reload left, right, and parent

[Source]

     # File lib/awesome_nested_set.rb, line 462
462:         def reload_nested_set
463:           reload(:select => "#{quoted_left_column_name}, " +
464:             "#{quoted_right_column_name}, #{quoted_parent_column_name}")
465:         end
set_default_left_and_right()

on creation, set automatically lft and rgt to the end of the tree

[Source]

     # File lib/awesome_nested_set.rb, line 429
429:         def set_default_left_and_right
430:           maxright = nested_set_scope.maximum(right_column_name) || 0
431:           # adds the new node to the right of all existing nodes
432:           self[left_column_name] = maxright + 1
433:           self[right_column_name] = maxright + 2
434:         end

412:         def without_self(scope)
413:           scope.scoped :conditions => ["#{self.class.table_name}.#{self.class.primary_key} != ?", self]
